title: European firms partner for LEO collision avoidance demo
summary: Three young European space companies said Jan. 9 they have teamed up to test a collision avoidance system on a small satellite this year in low Earth orbit.

title: Observing lightning with a cubesat constellation
summary: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center is working with Los Alamos National Laboratories and the University of Alabama, Huntsville, on Cubespark, a proposed constellation of six cubesats to map lightning.

title: Watch live: SpaceX Dragon cargo capsule set to depart space station
summary: A SpaceX Dragon cargo capsule is scheduled to depart the International Space Station at 5:05 p.m. EST (2205 GMT) Monday to close out a month-and-a-half of docked operations, heading to a predawn splashdown Wednesday off the coast of Florida with several tons of hardware and experiment specimens.

title: SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket rolls out for first launch of 2023
summary: SpaceX has assembled Falcon Heavy and rolled the rocket out to the launch pad for its first mission of 2023. This particular...

title: NASA Selects Experimental Space Technology Concepts for Initial Study
summary: Imagine a future in space where pellet-beam propulsion systems speed up travel to other worlds, pipelines on the Moon transport oxygen between settlements, and Martian bricks grow on their own before being assembled into homes.

title: Space Force looking to extend laser communications to satellites in higher orbits
summary: The U.S. Space Force is requesting information on laser communications systems to connect satellites in medium and high orbits.

title: NOAA declares GOES-18 operational ahead of schedule
summary: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration declared the newest satellite in its geostationary fleet, GOES-18, operational Jan. 4 and designated it GOES West.

title: NASA Names New Agency-Wide Chief Technologist
summary: A.C. Charania is NASA’s new chief technologist, serving as principal advisor to Administrator Bill Nelson on technology policy and programs at the agency’s Headquarters in Washington. He will lead technology innovation.

title: Virgin Orbit to conduct first mission from the UK with Start Me Up
summary: Virgin Orbit will carry out the first satellite launch from the United Kingdom on Monday with the first LauncherOne mission out of Spaceport Cornwall. LauncherOne will be dropped from Virgin’s Cosmic Girl carrier aircraft, with release expected off the coast of Ireland during a 10-minute window that opens at 22:16 UTC.

title: Virgin Orbit says it is ready to make history in the United Kingdom tonight
summary: "The public cannot wait for the UK to come and join that exclusive launch club."
